oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Improving Reproductive Performance in Dairy Cattle Via Milk Fever Prevention
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Oetzel, Garrett R.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: periparturient diseases
reproductive performance
Dystocia
retained placenta
cystic ovaries
metritis
milk fever
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The effects of periparturient diseases on reproductive performance have been reviewed.6 Dystocia, retained placenta, cystic ovaries, metritis, and any periparturient health problem were found to either directly or indirectly decrease reproductive performance. Because milk fever increases the relative risk of these important periparturient diseases, it indirectly, but predictably, decreases fertility.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1995; 52-59
